name: Chicken Rolls

steps.text: Melt butter in a microwaveable bowl.
Add all other non optional ingredients and stir with a fork until combined.
Open rolls and fill each triangular piece with a spoon of the chicken mixture.  (use a small cookie scoop)
Roll up staring at the large end and tucking in sides.
If desired you can dip each roll in melted butter and then bread crumbs for a different outside texture.
Place filled rolls on a greased cookie sheet with the small end point facing down.  (this keeps it from lifting open during the baking process.
Bake at 350Â° for 15 to 20 minutes until golden brown.
Serve warm with chicken gravy.

notes: Chicken gravy can be made with a mix, or you can make it from water, chicken bouillon, and cream of chicken soup.  You can also make this dough instead of buying it using the Chicken Roll Dough Recipe and rolling it out in a circle, and cutting it into 8 equal triangular pieces like a pizza.

steps.text: Preheat Oven to 350 Degrees
Mix together butter (softened to room temperature) and brown sugar.
Add Egg and vanilla to butter mixture and beat until very smooth
Add in flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda to mixture and only mix until it is combined (don't overmix)
Stir in chocolate chips (don't have to use exact measurements)
Form into balls and place on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 9-11 minutes depending on cookie sheet and oven.

name: Homemade rolls

steps.text: Heat milk in the microwave until very hot.
Mix in a bowl the heated milk, water, sugar, butter, and egg until combined.
Add to this mixture instant yeast as well as half the amount of flour.
Add in salt and the rest of the flour to the above mixture stirring with a spoon until it is all mixed together and forms a soft but not sticky dough.
Then on a clean surface add a small amount of flour and dump the dough onto it.  Knead the dough for 10 minutes.

After kneading the dough well, take a large bowl and put a tablespoon of vegetable oil or melted butter in it and grease the sides of the bowl and place the kneaded dough in it.  Cover with a clean towel or plastic wrap works good if you spray it so the dough wonât stick to it.  Place in a warm area and let raise for 1 hour.
Shape the dough into Balls and place in a pan or on a cookie sheet and let raise till they are double in size.
Bake for 18 - 20 minutes on 350 degrees.

notes:
I assume you are using a hand mixer, spoon, or wisk.  the amount of flour you need to add to make this a dough will be too stiff for anything but a large mixer or a spoon so use a strong spoon!

You need to knead this dough for 10 minutes!  Its not hard just takes muscles.  You just fold push turn.  You can google how to knead dough by hand and there are lots of videos showing how to do it.

name: 7 Layer Dip

steps.text: Spread refried beans in an even layer in the bottom of your serving dish.  Place in the refrigerator while you make Fresh Guacamole.
Spread fresh guacamole in an even layer over the beans
Top with a layer of salsa.
In a medium bowl, stir together sour cream, taco seasoning, and lime juice.  Spread this mixture in an even layer over the salsa by dropping in small spoonfuls and flattening out to spread
Sprinkle with monterey jack cheese and cheddar cheeses in an even layer over the sour cream.
Top with shredded lettuce, green onions, tomatoes, and black olives.
Serve immediately with tortilla chips.  Best eaten fresh.

notes: Can store in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

steps.text: Preheat oven to 350Â°
Remove stems from the mushrooms and discard.
Place cream cheese in a mixing bowl and let it sit at room temperature for 5 to 10 minutes to soften.
Stir cream cheese until smooth.
Then add garlic, bacon, cheese, and parsley and mix together well.
Spray a shallow baking dish with pan spray.
Place mushrooms top side down into the baking dish and spoon cream cheese mixture into the mushroom caps.
Bake for 18 to 20 minutes until heated through and cheese is melted.
Serve immediately.
Mix ingredients together until smooth.
Chill for at least 30 minutes.
Serve with vegetables or chips.
Mix ingredients together until smooth
Chill for 2 hours.
Taste for seasonings, serve with vegetables.

name: Fruit Dip

steps.text: Using an immersion Blender or other blender, mix cream cheese until smooth.
Add yogurt, powdered sugar, and fresh jam.   Mix well.

notes: Strawberry Fruit Dip:  Use strawberry yogurt & strawberry jam.  For Raspberry Fruit Dip:  Use raspberry yogurt & raspberry jam.

steps.text: Blend ingredients together and serve as a fruit dip.

Cut top off jalapeno.  Cut the bottom off the green onion.  Place all ingredients into a blender except â cup of tomatoes.  Pulse until green onion and jalapeno are incorporated.  Do not over mix.  It will look slightly green.
Add the â cup of tomatoes and barely pulse. This helps to bring back the red color of the salsa.   Chill & serve.
Combine all ingredients and serve

name: Banana Bread

steps.text: Beat bananas in a mixing bowl until they are mashed and smooth.
Add all other ingredients into your bowl.
Mix just until blended.  (Do not overmix!)
Spray two bread pans with nonstick spray.  (I like to use glass bread pans for this.)
Divide the dough mixture between the two bread pans.
Bake at 350Â° for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the loaf.
Let cool in the pans for 10 minutes.  Then remove the bread by turning the pan over onto a cooling rack and dumping the bread out.
Then turn loaves upright to cool.

notes: If you dump the loaves out without cooling for 10 minutes first, the bottom will stick to the bread pans and tear away from the loaf.

steps.text: Heat milk and butter together in a microwave until butter is melted and milk is warm.
Add the egg to this mixture and whisk thoroughly.
In your mixer bowl add 2/3 of the flour, the salt, baking soda, sugar, baking powder, and yeast.  Mix together.
Add milk mixture on low speed until moistened.  Then mix on high speed for 4 minutes
Change to the dough hook and gradually add the rest of the flour and knead on speed 2 or a higher speed for 4 minutes.
Put dough in an oiled bowl and cover with a towel or sprayed wrap or tin foil.  Let rise until double.

Divide the dough into two equal pieces and roll each piece out into a large circle.  Then cut into 8 pieces like a pizza.  Fill with chicken mixture and roll up.  Let rolls sit for 15 minutes before baking to allow the doughs to raise a bit after being filled.
Preheat the oven to 350Â°.  Spray a 9 x 13 cake pan or 12 cup muffin tin.
In a large bowl, combine 2 cups flour, white sugar, baking powder, Â½ tsp cinnamon, and salt.
In a small bowl, whisk milk, eggs, and melted butter until well blended
Stir wet ingredients into dry ingredients mixing only until moistened.  (Do not overmix)
Place batter in cake pan or muffin tin.

To make the topping, combine Â½ cup flour, Â¼ cup brown sugar, 1 Â½ tsp of cinnamon, and Â¼ cup of butter softened in a bowl and mix with a fork, whisk, or pastry cutter until the mixture is crumbly.  Sprinkle over cake or muffins.
Bake for 13-16 minutes or until golden brown
Drizzle with white frosting if desired.  Serve warm.

name: Crepes

steps.text: Add ingredients into a blender.
Blend for 30 seconds on high speed.
Scrape down the sides of the blender.
Blend for another 30 seconds.

Let the batter sit. (For best results at least 1 hour in the refrigerator.)  NOTE:  This makes working with the batter a little easier when cooking, but I often skip this step as I am making them when I donât have time for this.
Heat a comal type pan on medium high heat.  Spray with pan spray for the 1st one you cook.  (on my comal I never need to spray again, but your pan could be different)
Pour a small amount of batter on the center of the pan and swirl the pan causing the batter to spread out and make a thin large crepe.
Cook until the edges look a little dry.  Then flip with a large spatula using one fluid motion under and then flip.
Cook the other side and then slide off onto a plate.  Serve with fresh fruit and cream.

notes: NOTE:  When cooking for our whole family, I triple this recipe.

steps.text: Drain and rinse the black beans.
Cut chicken into narrow strips.  Saute the chicken in a large soup in the butter or olive oil with the garlic and onions until cooked.  Using scissors, chunk chicken.

Add to the chicken mixture the tomato sauce, green sauce or green chilis, drained black beans, corn including juice, chili powder, cumin, and chicken broth. Bring to a boil and simmer for 5-10 minutes.
While the soup is simmering, add the velveeta cheese stirring so the chunks melt completely. (optional step)
Add whipping cream and bring back to a boil.
Remove from heat and stir cheddar jack cheese.  Garnish and serve with sourcream, chips, and more grated cheese

name: Christmas Punch

steps.text: Place all ingredients in a large punch bowl or divide ingredients equally into two gallon pitchers.  Stir well and serve.

notes:
NOTE:  Another way to make this.  This way calls for no water, no vanilla, double the soda and orange juice and adds pebble ice.

In a large punch bowl add 2 12 oz cans of thawed orange juice, (or one of orange juice and one of pineapple juice),  1 12 oz can of lemonade, sugar, 1 T almond extract, and 1 2 liter bottle of Lemon Lime Soda.  Stir well.  Add a 2nd bottle of Lemon Lime Soda and one 8 lb bag of pebble ice.

name: Fettucine Alfredo

steps.text: Add water to a large pot and bring to boil.  Add noodles and cook according to the package directions.
In a saucepan, on medium low heat, melt butter and cream cheese stirring with a whisk until melted.
Add all other ingredients.
Cook slowly on medium heat until the mixture just starts to boil.  Stir often so the sauce does not burn.
Remove from the heat and let the sauce sit for 5-10 minutes.  It will thicken as it begins to cool during this time.
Stir and serve warm over drained noodles.

notes: NOTE:  Use shredded parmesan cheese for this recipe.  Using dry cheese such as Kraft will result in a sauce with a very grainy texture.  Optional:  Garnish with more grated cheese and fresh or dried parsley.

steps.text: Cook rice & chicken according to package directions.
Prepare beans by snipping ends, cut the carrots, cut the green onion, and slice the cabbage thinly.

In a small saucepan, combine garlic, vinegar, honey, chili sauce, ketchup, brown sugar, sesame oil, soy sauce, and cornstarch with a whisk and bring to a boil.  Turn down the heat and simmer until thickened.  Divide into 3 parts
Stir fry vegetables beginning with the beans and carrots and adding cabbage at the end.  Stir in â of the sauce.

Cut chicken strips and coat with â of the sauce.  Put rice on the bottom of the platter.  Cover rice with vegetables.  Add Chicken on top and green onions.  Sprinkle with sesame seeds and drizzle with the rest of the sauce.
Add liquids to the blender first so you can use the measuring lines on the blender for your measurements.
Add all other ingredients into the blender, adding ice always last.  Blend until smooth
Slightly thaw peaches in the microwave for 1 minute and break into smaller chunks.
Add the milk first to the blender using its measuring lines.  Then add all other ingredients and blend until smooth.
Chop tomatoes and combine with all other ingredients.
Place on a toasted baguette slices and top with parmesan and mozzarella cheese.  Broil until melted.
Pulse basil, spinach and nuts in a food processor.
Add garlic and cheese and pulse several more times
Stream in olive oil while the food processor is running.  Adding slowly helps it emulsify.  Stir in salt and pepper to taste.
Cut, peel, and pit avocados and place in a medium sized bowl.  Add the lime juice and salt and mash avocados.
Mix in onions, tomatoes, garlic & cayenne Pepper.  Stir.
Refrigerate for 1 hour for best flavor.  Serve.
Place undrained tomatoes and cheese in a saucepan on medium heat and cook for 5 minutes until cheese is melted and sauce is creamy.  Add milk if too thick.

name: Hot and Cheesy Spinach Artichoke Dip

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 375Â°.
Chop spinach, pepper, and artichokes to desired size.
In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese.  Add sour cream and mayonnaise and mix until smooth and fluffy.
Stir in garlic, spinach, artichokes, peppers, parmesan cheese and 1 cup of mozzarella cheese.
Add basil, parsley, paprika, pepper, & lemon juice and stir.
Spoon into a sprayed baking dish and spread out evenly.
Top with the rest of the mozzarella cheese.
Bake for 20-22 minutes uncovered until dip is hot, bubbly, and golden on top.
Serve with baguette slices.
Wash, core, and put tomatoes in boiling water to split skins.  Then put in cold water to cool and peel.  Squeeze tomatoes to seed and get some water/juice out of them.
Place tomatoes in a food processor and chop to the consistency you like.  Then strain out excess water, and measure out 10 cups into a large pot.
Weigh onions, peppers, jalapenos, and cilantro and chop in a food processor as well.  Add to the tomatoes.
Add all other ingredients except for citric acid.
Bring to boil, stirring occasionally.
Bottle, add citric acid Â¼ tsp per pint, Â½ tsp per quart to top of bottle.  Then lid and process for 25 minutes for pints, and 50 minutes for quarts in a water bath canner.
In a measuring cup, combine milk and lemon juice.  Let sit for 5-10 minutes.  (This is what I make to substitute for buttermilk.  However you could use just one cup of buttermilk if you have it.)
Pour milk/lemon mixture (called sour milk) into a saucepan and add butter and sugar and stir to combine.
Bring to a boil and reduce heat.  Boil for 3-5 minutes stirring frequently.
Remove from heat and add vanilla and baking soda stirring continuously.
The mixture will foam up but continue stirring until everything is mixed together well.
Serve warm.
Store in the refrigerator.
In a large pot, saute onion and garlic in olive oil until onions are transparent.
Prepare green pepper, jalapeno, tomatillos, and cilantro and place in a blender.
Add to the vegetables in the blender the sauteed onions and garlic and the broth.  Blend until smooth or the texture you desire.
Transfer blended sauce into the large pot and add salt and cumin.
Simmer on medium for 10-15 minutes or until the sauce has boiled down and reached your desired consistency.
Use this sauce for enchiladas or in making chicken enchilada chili soup.

name: Sweet & Sour Sauce

steps.text: In a small saucepan, combine brown sugar and cornstarch with a whisk.
Add all other ingredients except food coloring.
Cook on medium high heat stirring occasionally with a whisk until mixture begins to boil and thicken.
Boil for 1 minute then turn off heat.
Add food coloring if desired.
Serve warm.

notes: This sauce can be used for Sweet & Sour Chicken or as a dipping sauce for gyozas, egg rolls, etc.

steps.text: Place everything but the salt and cilantro in your electric pressure cooker and set to pressure cook for 50 minutes.
Slow release for another 15-20.
Drain if needed and add lime juice and cilantro.
Salt if needed.  Serve.
Drain and rinse beans.  Place all ingredients into a saucepan.  Bring to boil.  Reduce heat and simmer for 5-10 minutes on medium to low heat.
Serve Warm
In a saucepan, put rice, butter, garlic, broth, water, and tsp of lime juice and bring to a boil.  Cover, turn to low and cook for 15 minutes until rice is done.
Mix Tbsp lime juice, sugar, and fresh cilantro together and pour on cooked rice and stir in.  Serve.
In a saucepan, put rice, butter, garlic, broth, water, and lime juice and bring to a boil.
Cover, turn to low and cook for 15 minutes until rice is done.

name: Au Gratin Potatoes (Hashbrown)

steps.text: Melt Butter
Mix butter, soup, milk, sour cream, salt, pepper, and dried onions together in a bowl.
In a separate bowl, mix hash browns and 1 Â½ cups of cheese together.  Pour soup mixture over hash browns and stir together.
Pour soup mixture over hash browns and stir together.
Spray a 9 x 13 pan.
Put potato mixture into the pan and top with the leftover Â½ cup of cheese.
Cover with tin foil and bake at 350Â° for 1 hour.

notes: You can mix all the cheese with the potatoes and then make this alternative topping if desired.  2 T butter mixed with 1 Â½ cups of crushed corn flakes.  Top the casserole with this mixture.  Do not cover.  Bake.

name: Homemade Refried Beans

steps.text: Bring beans and water to a boil and boil hard for 5 minutes.  Pour off this water and add the same amount of clean water and bring to a boil.  Turn heat down to medium low, cover beans, simmer for 2 Â½ to 3 hours.

When beans are tender, melt shortening in a frying pan and add flour.  Stir until flour has browned.  While still hot add 1-2 cups of beans and liquid.  Stir until mixed and then add this back to the other beans.  Add salt to taste and cook on medium low for 30 more minutes.

To make âRefried Beans,â heat 2 T of shortening in a skillet.  Add 1-2 cups of cooked beans and mash with potato masher.If you are using these for a burrito filling, add some dry taco seasoning to the beans and cook until thickened.

notes: TO MAKE THESE USING AN INSTAPOT:  Soak beans in water overnight and it will only take 20 minutes to cook.  Non soaked beans take 40 minutes to cook.  Place 2 cups of beans in your pot and cover with water by 1â or more.  Put in whole pieces of onion that will be easy to remove.  Cook on high pressure cook for the time listed above.  Drain out extra water (leaving a little with the beans.  Remove onion.  Use a stick blender to mash.  Add 2 tsp salt, 2 tsp cumin, 1 T oil, Â½-1 tsp garlic powder.   Serve warm.

steps.text: Spread the white rice in a 9 x 13 pan.
Sprinkle the wild rice over the top of the white rice.
Sprinkle salt, soup mix, and bouillon evenly over the rice.
Cut butter into small flat squares and place on top of rice.
Pour water over rice.
Cover with aluminum foil and seal tight.
Bake at 350Â° for 1 hour.
Whisk together in a mixing bowl the yeast, water, and FIRST flour until smooth.  Let stand for 10 to 15 minutes.  (Should look foamy on top.)
Add FIRST egg, melted butter, sugar, and salt and mix together.
Switch to a dough hook and add SECOND flour a cup at a time.
Knead for 6 minutes.  (This dough is very soft and somewhat sticky.)
Put dough in an oiled large bowl and cover with aluminium foil and raise until double in size.

Spray your work surface with non-stick spray and roll dough out into a rectangle.  Cut into 8 equal parts.  Form into a disk and flatten to â inch thick.  Arrange on a cookie sheet in a 2-1-2-1-2 pattern.  Cover and rise for 1 hour.
Whisk SECOND egg and milk and lightly brush on top without pushing down and then sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Bake at 350Â° for 15-17 minutes until golden brown.  Cool.

name: Homemade Tortillas

steps.text: Heat water to almost boiling in a microwave.
Add all ingredients into your mixer.
Using your dough hook, mix together and then knead this dough for 1 minute.
This dough should be very soft and pliable but not sticky.  Tweak the amounts slightly of flour or water to get that consistency.
Let the dough rest for 5 minutes.
Roll out dough into a rectangle and cut into 16 equal pieces.  Make each piece into a flat disk
Roll each disk into a tortilla.
Heat up your pan.
Cook tortillas on one side until bubbles start to form.  Flip and cook on the other side.  Wrap in a white dish towel immediately after removing from the pan to keep soft.

notes: NOTE:  Secrets for success are HOT WATER, and when rolling them out remember flour is your friend.  Donât be afraid to use it.   I cook my tortillas on a comal type pan.  For whole wheat tortillas use fine ground wheat flour.

steps.text: Heat drinking water in the microwave for 1 Â½ minutes.  (Bath water 105Â° temperature.  Too hot destroys the yeast, and too cold increases the rising time.)
Pour the heated water into the mixer and add yeast, sugar, oil, most of the flour, and the salt on top of the flour.
Using the dough hook, begin mixing the dough.  It will start to form a dough that is a bit sticky.
As it mixes the first minute, continue adding small amounts of flour until the dough is soft but completely pulling away from the sides and center of the bowl.
Knead on speed 2 for 8-10 minutes.  Spray 3 standard size loaf pans with nonstick spray.  Divide dough into 3 equal pieces, form into loaves, and place in bread pans.
Cover with a cloth and let rise until the dough is slightly above the top of the pan.  Put into a non preheated oven.
Bake at 350Â° for 35 minutes.  Remove bread from pans immediately (so it doesnât sweat) and cool on a rack
In a 2 cup glass measuring cup dissolve yeast and (tsp) sugar into the warm water and set aside.
Combine in your mixer the milk, (cups) sugar, salt, shortening, and potato flakes.  Then let cool for about 5 minutes.
Beat eggs in a separate bowl with a whisk.
Add beaten eggs and yeast mixture to the other ingredients in your mixing bowl and turn on low speed.
While mixing, begin adding the flour 1 cup at a time until the dough pulls away from the sides of the bowl.
Knead the dough on medium speed for 5 minutes.
Place dough in a large bowl and cover.  Let rise for 1 hou
Knotted rolls:  Separate dough into 3 pieces and roll each into a rectangle.  Butter surface, fold in half, cut in strips.  Tie strip into a knot and tuck under ends.
Crescent rolls:  Roll into 3 circles.  Cut each into 8 pieces and roll up-large end to small end tucking tip underneath.
Place on a cookie sheet, let rise 1 Â½ to 3 hours.  Bake at 375Â° for 12 minutes.  Brush rolls with butter after cooking.  Note:  Can use this recipe for cinnamon rolls.

name: Wheat Bread (Magic mill)

steps.text: Grind 5 cups of wheat berries.
In a mixer using a dough hook, add water, dough enhancer, lemon juice, sugar, and oil and begin mixing.
Add in this order while mixing is running:  1/2 the wheat flour, Salt, and yeast and let this mix in good.

Add the rest of the wheat flour, one cup at a time until your dough reaches the desired consistency.  (Dough should be coming off the sides of the bowl at this point  but still be a fairly soft elastic dough.
Knead dough for 6-8 minutes.
Form into loaves, let rise, and bake at 325Â° for 25 minutes.
Remove from pans and let cool on a rack.

notes: NOTE:  This dough can also be used for whole wheat pizza crusts, whole wheat pitas, or whole wheat cinnamon rolls.  See pizza dough, pita, and cinnamon roll recipes for baking instructions.

name: Pizza Dough

steps.text: Place all ingredients into a mixing bowl with a dough hook.  I like to start with the water, yeast and sugar first.  Then add the oil, flour, and salt on the top of the flour.
Mix together and then knead for 6-8 minutes.
Roll out 3 large pizza skins for regular crust.

notes: NOTE:  If you are using this for a thicker crust, it will make 1 less pizza.   You may also use this dough for breadsticks.

name: Sweet Cornbread

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 350Â° and spray a 9 x 13 cake pan.
In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate microwaveable bowl, melt butter.
Add the eggs to the utter and whisk until smooth.
Add milk and oil and whisk until well combined.
Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture.  Stir just until blended.  DO NOT OVERMIX.  Doing so makes the cornbread heavy
Quickly and gently place batter in the pan spreading it out even with the least amount of pressure so as to not break the air bubbles that are forming.
Bake for 15-22 minutes until lightly golden brown.

notes: NOTE:  You can make your own cornmeal from popcorn kernels by grinding a scant â cup of kernels in your wheat grinder on a medium to fine setting.  That will make the Â½ cup of cornmeal.

name: Sweet Dinner rolls

steps.text: Dissolve yeast in warm water in a mixing bowl.
Mix in milk, sugar, shortening, egg, half of the flour, and salt using your whisk or paddle beaters.  Beat âtil smooth.
Change to a dough hook and mix in the rest of the flour.  Dough should be soft.  Do not add too much flour
Knead for 6-8 minutes.
Place dough in an oiled bowl and cover and let rise until at least double
Form dough into dinner rolls.  Cover and let rise.
Bake at 350Â° for 18-20 minutes until golden brown

notes:
Cinnamon Rolls:  Roll out dough in a rectangle.  Spread with 4 T of softened butter.  Sprinkle with Brown Sugar & Cinnamon.  Roll, cut, place on cookie sheet, cover,  rise, and bake.  Frost.

Orange Rolls:  Beat 6 T of butter with 2 T Orange Peel and 4 T Orange Juice and 3 cups Powdered Sugar until smooth.  Roll dough into a rectangle.  Spread Â½ of the orange mixture on dough.  Roll, cut, place on cookie sheet, cover,  rise, and bake.
Spread with the rest of the orange mixture

steps.text: Heat water to 105Â° (bath water temperature)
Add water, yeast, and half of the white flour to your mixing bowl and mix with whisks until combined.  Let sit for 10 minutes.

Change to the dough hook.  Then add all other ingredients to your mixing bowl placing the dough enhancer and the salt on top of the remaining flour.  Start with adding only 3 cups of wheat flour.  Then add more if needed.
Knead dough for 6 to 8 minute of medium speed.
Roll out dough into a rectangle on a floured surface until it is 1â thick.  Cut with a pizza cutter into the shape you desire and separate pieces so when they raise they do not join each other.
Let scones rise for Â½ to 1 hour.
Lightly brush off flour and fry in oil at 350Â° with the side that was facing up while rising being placed face down in the oil.   Cook for 1 -2 minutes on each side.
Preheat the oven to Bake 375Â°
Spray two bread pans.
Finely grate zucchini and measure out correct amount of cups and place in the mixing bowl
Add eggs, brown sugar, white sugar, oil, and vanilla and mix.  (I do this in my mixer with whisk attachments.)
Add all remaining ingredients and fold in. (meaning mix only until ingredients are incorporated.  Do Not Overmix.)
Pour batter into the two bread pans and bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Let cool for 10 minutes and then remove from pans and cool the rest of the way on a cooling rack.

name: Apple Crisp

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 350Â°.  Spray a 9 x 13 pan.
In a mixing bowl, combine apple slices, white sugar, Â¾ tsp of cinnamon, and lemon juice and stir.  Arrange apples in the pan.
In a mixing bowl, mix butter, flour, oats, brown sugar, 1 tsp of cinnamon, a pinch of salt, and the diced cold butter.
Use a pastry cutter to cut the butter into the oat mixture using a slight downward twisting motion until the mixture resembled pea-sized crumb.  (You can also do this with two forks.)
Spread topping over apples in the baking dish evenly.
Bake for 40-50 minutes until golden brown and bubbly.
Serve warm with cream or vanilla ice cream

notes: NOTE:  You can use bottled cinnamon apples instead of fresh apples to save time.  Just do step 1 and then dump the bottled apples in the pan.  Then do steps 3-7 reducing the baking time by 10-15 minutes.

steps.text: Using cookie paddles in your mixer and beat butter and vanilla until smooth.
Add powdered sugar Â½ cup at a time and beat until smooth.
Gradually add the milk and beat until you reach your desired consistency.  Refrigerate any leftovers.
Using cookie paddles in your mixer and beat butter, cream cheese, and vanilla until smooth.
Add powdered sugar Â½ cup at a time and beat until desired consistency.  Refrigerate any leftovers.

name: Cherry Filled Cookies

steps.text: In a small bowl, mix flour, cream of tartar, and baking soda with a whisk.
In a mixing bowl, beat butter and sugar until smooth.
Add milk and egg and beat until smooth.
Fold in flour mixture until just combined. (This will look like sugar cookie dough.)
Chill dough to make it slightly easier to roll out.
Divide dough into two equal pieces.  Roll out two 9 x 13 rectangles. (cake pan size) One for the bottom crust and one for the top crust.
Spray the cake pan and put down the bottom crust.  Top with cherry pie filling.  (using the amount desired)
Lay top crust on top.
Bake at 375Â° for 10 to 15 minutes.  Cool completely.
Drizzle a buttercream frosting on top.  Slice to serve

notes:
Small Buttercream Frosting Recipe
Â¼ cup Butter, 1 tsp Vanilla, 1 Â¼ cups Powdered Sugar, Â¾ T Milk
Mix all ingredients together.  Add more milk if too thick.  Put in a frosting bag or plastic bag & poke with a fork to drizzle top.

name: Cherry Pie Filling

steps.text: Combine all ingredients, except red food coloring, into a large pot on the stove.
Stir well to dissolve the cornstarch so there are not lumps.

Cook until it is boiling and bubbly, stirring occasionally so it does not burn.  The mixture thickens as it boils so be careful to not boil for too long or the pie filling will become too thick and when cooked as a pie will be rubbery instead of a softer texture.
Remove from heat.  Add food coloring drops.

notes: NOTE:  When I get a can of cherries from the farm I let it thaw out almost all the way so the juice and cherries are separated somewhat.  Then I put into a freezer bag 2 cups of drained cherries and the Â½ cup of juice.  So when I make this recipe I just dump the bag of cherries and juice combined into the large pot.

steps.text: Mix together flour, butter, and powdered sugar and press onto a greased cookie sheet.  Bake at 325Â° for 13-15 min.
Whip cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla and spread on cooled crust.  Top with fruit and serve.
Slice 8-9 fresh peaches and place in a bowl.  Stir in lemon juice and sugar.  Let sit for 30 minutes stirring twice during that time.
Combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar and melted butter to form the crust.   Pour into a 9 x 13 cake pan and press down hard to the bottom.  Chill in Freezer.
In a mixer, blend cream cheese until smooth.  Add sugar and mix until smooth.  Fold in Cool Whip and spread this mixture onto the chilled crust.  Place in the fridge to chill.
Drain juice from the peaches until you have 1 cup of peach juice.  Place it in a saucepan.  Mix cornstarch into the juice and cook on medium heat until thickened.
Remove from heat and add butter, salt, and almond extract.  Cool completely.  Pour over drained peaches and then place the peaches on top of the cream cheese layer.
Chill for 2-4 hours and serve topped with whipped cream
Cream together melted butter and sugar.
Add eggs one at a time beating well in between each egg.
Add vanilla and mix.
In a small bowl, mix flour, baking powder, and salt together with a whisk.
Add the flour mixture to the wet mixture and mix well.
Spread into a greased 9 x 13 pan.
Bake at 350Â° for 20 minutes.
Mix together butter and cocoa until smooth.
Add vanilla and mix.
Add powdered sugar and milk and mix together well until frosting is creamy.  Spread on cooled brownies.
Mix butter, flour, and powdered sugar to make the crust.
Press into a 9 x 13 pan and bake at 350Â° for 15 minutes.
To make the Filling:  Mix eggs, Â¼ cup flour, 2 cups sugar, and 6 T Lemon Juice until sugar is completely dissolved.
Pour over the slightly cooled crust.  Bake at 350Â° for 25 minutes.  Cool completely and dust with powdered sugar.
Chop cake into bite sized pieces.  Layer cups with cake, cream, berries, and repeat until the cup is full.  Garnish top with fruit.
To make the crust, place 25 oreo cookies with filling into a food processor and blend until it is crumbs.  Add the crumbs to the melted butter, stir, and press into a pie pan.
Let ice cream melt slightly, enough to work with.  Layer ice cream, toppings, & oreos creating at least two layers.
Cover with wrap and refreeze.  Serve with fresh cream and garnish with toppings and oreos.
Cook sugar, sprite, and cornstarch until thickened.  Add food color.  Chill.  Fold in strawberries & place in the crust.  Chill 1 hour.  Serve topped with whipped cream.

Melt butter and stir it and the â cup of sugar and graham cracker crumbs together to make the crust.  Pour into a 9â springform pan and pack in very tightly using the bottom of a measuring cup and fork for the sides.  Freeze 10-20 minutes while you prepare the filling.
Using a mixer with whisks, whip cream to stiff peaks on medium to high speed.  (It takes about 4-5 minutes.  When done move to another bowl and chill.)
In the same mixer bowl, using cookie paddles, beat the cream cheese.  Then add the sugar and beat âtil creamy.
Add the rest of the ingredients and whip for 2-3 minutes until everything is very smooth and combined, no lumps.
Using a rubber spatula, fold in the whipped cream.
Remove the crust from the freezer and spread the filling into the crust.  Cover with wrap and chill for 8-12 hours or overnight.  Serve with Fruit Topping of choice.
Blend butter, shortening, sugars, for several minutes until they are blended really well.
Add vanilla and mix in.
Add eggs, one at a time mixing well in between each one
In a small bowl, whisk flour, baking soda, and salt together.  Then add the oats and stir.
Add dry mixture to the wet mixture and mix only until combined.  Do not over mix.
Fold in raisins and scoop onto a greased cookie sheet
Bake in a preheated oven at 350Â° for 12 minutes.
Mix cake mix, oil, and eggs together and roll into 1â balls.
Bake at 350Â° for 12 minutes and cool on a rack.
Mix cream cheese until there are no lumps.  Add the rest of the ingredients and mix until light and fluffy.  Spread filling between two cookies.  Serve.

In a large pan or microwaveable bowl melt butter and marshmallows.  (1-2 min. in a microwave) Stir until smooth and then mix in rice krispies.  Press into a 9 x 13 buttered cake pan.  Press firmly. Cool, cut, & enjoy.

name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Bars

steps.text: In a bowl or mixer, combine butter, peanut butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until mixed well.
Add egg and vanilla and mix until smooth and creamy.
Sprinkle baking soda and salt on top and add flour and oats and mix until all of the ingredients are combined.
Spray a cookie sheet with pan spray.
Place dough on the cookie sheet in big spoonfuls and then press down evenly to cover the entire cookie sheet, trying to spread the dough out as evenly as possible.
Bake at 350Â° for 13 minutes. DO NOT OVERCOOK or they will be hard and crunchy.
Let cool and frost with chocolate frosting.  Cut into bars.

notes: NOTE:  You can use 1 cup flour and Â½ cup wheat flour instead of all white flour to make these a little more healthy and they taste better too.  You can buy a can of chocolate frosting or make it from scratch.  (see Chocolate Frosting Recipe)

steps.text: Preheat Oven to 350Â° and line two baking sheets with silicone liners or parchment paper.
In a small bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
In a mixing bowl with cookie paddles, cream together butter, white sugar and brown sugar until combined.
Mix in peanut butter well, and then mix in egg & vanilla.
Add flour mixture and mix on low just until combined.
Scoop dough out into balls and place on sheet 2â apart.
Using a long pronged fork, flatten cookies slightly and then turn the fork going the opposite direction and flatten just slightly again.  (makes a criss cross pattern)
Bake, one sheet at a time, for about 9 minutes.  Cookies  will appear pale and slightly underbaked, theyâll  continue to cook slightly as they cool.
Let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes then transfer to a cooling rack to finish cooling.  Store in an airtight container.
Melt butter in a microwavable mixing bowl.
Mix cocoa into the melted butter.
Add the beaten eggs, sugar, vanilla, and flour into the butter cocoa mixture.
Mix only until all ingredients are combined.  DO NOT OVERMIX!
Spray a 9 x 13 cake pan with pan spray and spread batter evenly in the pan.
Bake at 350Â° for 25 to 30 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Do not overcook or they will be crunch
Mix well the butter, cocoa, vanilla, powdered sugar and milk in a mixing bowl until you have the desired consistency for your frosting.
Frost brownies and serve.

Make pie crust mix by combining flour, salt, and shortening.  Do this in your mixer with whisks so you create a cornmeal type texture, or use a pastry blender until you have small pea sized particles.
Place drinking water in a cup with some ice
In a separate bowl whip the egg and add the vinegar and the ice water measured out in tablespoons.
Pour the egg mixture over the pie crust mix in your mixing bowl and mix with a dough hook or stir with a fork until it makes a soft ball of dough. (Not sticky but not dry)

For a two crust pie:  On a floured surface, roll out half of the dough into a circle a little bit bigger than the circumference of your pie pan.  Lift and put into the pan ensuring that the dough is all the way down into the pan and up the sides letting it hang over.  Fill the pie with your preferred fruit filling.  Wet the edges with water to help the top crust stick.   Roll out the other half of the dough for your top crust.  After placing it on top, press down on the edges and seal with an edge design.
For two shells, use two pie pans with bottoms crusts only.
In a bowl, whip cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla until smooth.  Fold in Cool Whip and then place in pie crust & chill.
Crack eggs in a small bowl, beat slightly with a fork and set aside.

In a large saucepan combine sugar and cornstarch. Whisk in milk and fresh lemon juice and stir to combine. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thick and bubbling.  Reduce heat to low and cook for two more minutes.

Add a spoonful of the hot mixture into the egg yolks and stir well. Repeat this process with two or three more spoonfuls of the hot mixture added to the egg yolks. (The goal is to temper the egg yolks so they don't cook when added to the hot saucepan.)  Poor egg mixture into the saucepan and stir well. Bring mixture to a gentle boil and cook for two more minutes.
Remove from heat.  Add softened butter and lemon zest and stir until butter melts completely. Allow mixture to cool and then stir in sour cream.  Place this on top of cream cheese layer
Chill for 3-4 hours & then top with whipped cream and serve.
Combine shortening, butter, sugar, and vanilla in a mixing bowl and beat until smooth.
Add eggs one at a time mixing well in between each egg.
In a small bowl combine, flour, baking powder, and salt with a whisk.  Fold into the dough just until incorporated.  DO NOT OVERMIX!  Refrigerate Dough for 1 hour.
Roll dough out ââ thick.  Be careful to keep dough even and not too thin so cookies are soft and bake evenly.
Cut and place on an ungreased cookie sheet.
Bake in a preheated oven at 400Â° for 6-8 minutes.
They are done when the bottoms are slightly golden brown but tops are not.
Mix together the flour, brown sugar, and butter well.
Add egg and mix well.
Stir in 3/4 of the chocolate chips and all of the nuts.  Divide this crumb mixture in half.  Press one half of it into the bottom of a 9 x 13 pan.  Bake for 10 minutes at 350Â°
Pour milk evenly over the hot crust and top with 1 cup of the toffee bits.  Put the rest of the crumb mixture on
Put the rest of the crumb mixture on top and add the remaining 1/4 of the chocolate chips on top.
Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden brown on top.
Sprinkle the remaining Â¾ cup of toffee bits on top and cool.   Cut into bars and serve.
In a mixing bowl, beat butter, cocoa powder, melted chocolate chips, vanilla, and salt.
Add powdered sugar, about Â½ cup at a time and beat until smooth.
Gradually pour in small amounts of milk while mixing the frosting until you get to the consistency you want your frosting to be.
Refrigerate any leftovers.

name: Decorators Buttercream Icing

steps.text: Cream together butter and shortening.  Add vanilla.
Gradually add sugar, one cup at a time.
Add milk & meringue powder and beat âtil light and fluffy.

notes: NOTE:  This icing is for decorating cakes.  It holds its shape.

steps.text: In a saucepan, boil corn syrup, sugar, and butter for 2 minutes.
In a very large bowl, mix together the three cereals, coconut and almonds.
Slowly pour hot mixture over cereals stirring continuously to mix it well.
Cool and munch like popcorn.

name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Protein Energy Balls

steps.text: Add to the mixing bowl all ingredients except chocolate chips.  Mix until combined.  Fold in chocolate chips.  Form balls with a small  cookie scoop, make balls and place on a parchment lined cookie sheet.  Refrigerate for 30 min.  Store in a bag in the fridge
Mix all ingredients together.  Use a small cookie scoop to roll into balls.  Store in a fridge.
In a large bowl, beat egg whites until frothy; beat in vanilla.
Add almonds:  stir gently to coat
In a small bowl, combine the sugars, salt, and cinnamon.
Add to nut mixture and stir gently to coat.
Spread evenly in 2 greased 15x10x1 inch baking pans.
Bake at 300Â° for 25-30 minutes or until almonds are crisp, stirring once.
Cool.  Store in an airtight container.
Pop popcorn in an air popper.  Place on a heavy cookie sheet with sides.  Add peanuts if desired.
In a saucepan, mix sugar, butter, and corn syrup.  Cook until boiling, stirring occasionally.
Turn to medium low heat and boil without stirring for 5 minutes.
Remove from heat and add vanilla and baking soda.  You will need to work quickly at this point as this mixture will set up and harden quickly.
Pour sauce over popcorn and stir gently to coat well all pieces.
Bake in a preheated oven at 250Â° for 1 hour.  Stir during cooking every 15 minutes.
Cool on a sheet of parchment paper and break into smaller pieces.  Store in an airtight container or bag.
Mix together in a large bowl the milk, oats, nuts, & seeds.
In a microwaveable glass bowl, place the honey, oil, and peanut butter.

Cook in the microwave for a total of 1 Â½ minutes stirring half of the way through the cooking time.  The goal is to just melt these ingredients enough that they will combine together.  You do not want to heat them very much and definitely not boil them.
Combine the wet and the dry mixes together well.
Spray two cookie sheets.
Divide the granola in half, placing each half on a cookie sheet and spread it out.
Bake both trays in the oven at once at 250Â° for 15 minutes.
Rotate the trays and bake for 10 more minutes. Do not over bake.  It will cause the granola to be too crunchy.
Cool well and then place in an airtight container.  It will store for about 3 weeks.

Heat oven to 375 degrees and line a large baking sheet with silicone or parchment.* Place the raw almonds in a large metal or ceramic mixing bowl (we'll be adding the hot nuts back into it, so don't use plastic).

Stir 1Â½ teaspoon of salt into the hot water until mostly dissolved (it hardly ever completely dissolves for me - it's okay if it doesn't), pour over the nuts in the bowl and mix until all are coated.
Transfer to the prepared baking sheet, spreading the nuts in a single layer.

Bake for about 8 minutes, stir well and spread back into a single layer. Bake for 6-8 minutes more, depending on how your oven cooks (Ours are usually perfect at about 15 minutes total, but your oven may vary, so may take 5-10 minutes longer). To test doneness, the nuts should be nicely browned, inside and out (you can cut one open to see if it's browned inside). Keep an eye on them, this is when they can burn quickly - but you don't want them undercooked either or they won't be crisp (once you've made them, the timing is easier).

When they are done baking, put the hot nuts back into the large bowl and pour the olive oil over them. Toss well until all the nuts are coated, shaking on sea salt as you go. You can taste one, but they're very hot, so be careful (I usually just like to see a bit of salt on the outsides and that seems to be enough with the original salt-water coating).
Leave the nuts to cool in the bowl, or spread out on the pan again if you need them to cool more quickly. The nuts will soak up the oil as they cool.**
Store in an airtight container at room temperature.
Mix the first seven ingredients into a large bowl. Combine well.
Heat in a saucepan, the water, oil, honey, and peanut butter until it begins to bubble.
Remove from heat, add vanilla, and then pour over the dry ingredients.
Mix well and spread on two large cookie sheets.
Bake in the oven at 200-225Â° for about one hour or until coconut is golden.  Stir occasionally while baking.
Let cool and store in an airtight container.

name: White Lightning Chicken Chili

steps.text: Drain and rinse 1 can of beans and place in a bowl.  Mash with a fork and add garlic and stir.
Drain and rinse the remaining two cans of beans.
In a soup pot, add oil and onion and saute until clear.
Add bean and garlic mixture, 2 cans of beans, and all the other ingredients to the pot except cilantro.
Bring to a boil and simmer for 25 minutes.
Combine cornstarch and water with a whisk.  Add to chili and cook for 5 more minutes.
Remove from heat.  Add cilantro.
Serve with avocado, tortilla chips, shredded cheese, and sour cream

notes: Southwest Seasoning:  2 T Chili Powder, 2 T Paprika, 1 T Salt,   1 T Oregano, 2 tsp Cumin, 1 tsp Black Pepper, Â½ tsp Red Pepper (ground cayenne).  Put all ingredients in a ziplock sandwich bag.  Mix together and scoop out for recipe 2 T.  Store the rest in the bag for the next time you make the soup.

steps.text: Drain and rinse black beans.  Mince onion and jalapeno.  Dice chicken into chunks.
In a large soup pot, fry chicken in 1 T of Olive Oil until brown and no longer pink.  Remove from the pan.  (omit this step if using canned chicken)
Using the same pan, saute onion in olive oil for 2 minutes.  Then add garlic and peppers and saute until tender.
Add water, chicken bouillon, tomato sauce, beans, corn, and seasonings.  Bring to a boil.  Boil for 5 minutes.
Add chicken, lime juice, and cilantro and boil for 2 more minutes.  Serve topped with cheese, avocado, sour cream and chips.
Fry bacon strips until crisp but not overcooked.  Drain and crumble into pieces.
Wash and dice potatoes.
In a large soup pot, saute onion and garlic in butter until onions are clear.
Add chicken broth, potatoes, salt, seasoning salt, and pepper.  Boil until potatoes are soft.
While the potatoes are boiling, add the velveeta cheese.  Stir occasionally to help cheese melt.
Add whipping cream and bring back to a boil.
Remove from heat.  Stir in sour cream, a few bacon pieces, a few chives, and 1 cup of cheddar cheese.
Serve into bowls and garnish with cheese, bacon pieces, and chives.
Drain and rinse black beans.
Cut chicken into bite sized pieces.
Melt the butter in a soup pot on medium heat.  Add chicken and cook until lightly browned and no longer pink.
Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
Add tomatoes, corn, beans, broth, salsa, cilantro, and cumin.  Bring to a boil and reduce heat.  Simmer  for 20 minutes.
Place in each bowl some cheese, diced avocado,  and chips.  Ladle soup over the top and then garnish with a double of sour cream.  Eat immediately.

name: Potato Cheese Soup

steps.text: Add butter and onion to a large soup pot and saute until onions start to turn clear.  Add garlic and saute for 1-2 more minutes.
Add water, chicken bouillon, garlic powder, black pepper, season salt, salt, potatoes, and carrots to the pot and boil until the potatoes are soft. (Test by poking with a fork.)
Add the peas, milk, and cream.
Bring soup back to a boil stirring so soup does not burn.
Once the soup begins to boil again, turn off the heat.  Add the cheddar cheese and stir in.  Garnish and serve warm.

notes: NOTE:  Always add the cheese after the heat has been turned off to keep the cheese from making the soup have a grainy texture.  The soup is hot enough to melt the cheese just fine.

name: taco soup

steps.text: In a large soup pan, fry the ground beef until done and broken into small pieces.  (if you want a vegetarian style omit this step)
While meat is frying, drain and rinse all three kinds of beans in a strainer.
Add to the pot (and the meat) the corn including juice, salsa, rinsed beans, chilis, tomato sauce, water, chili powder, taco seasoning, and salsa.
Add more water if needed.  (when i make this soup I use a quart of V8 juice instead of tomato sauce and water which is also an option.
Simmer the soup on medium low for 10-15 minutes.
Serve warm with tortilla chips, cheese, sour cream, etc.

notes: NOTE:  In this recipe you can use the chili powder and taco seasoning, or just 1 Â½ T of chili powder and omit the taco seasoning.

steps.text: Rinse beans and place in an instant pot with 6 cups of water and pressure cook for 35 minutes.
Chop onion, carrots, and celery into small pieces.
When beans are done, release steam, drain beans and rinse well.
Add oil to the instant pot and saute onions and garlic.  When onions are clear, add carrots and celery and saute for 1 minute stirring continuously.
Add to the vegetables, 2 cups of water, V8, diced tomatoes, beans, and all of the spices.
Slow cook on high for 30 minutes.  (Until vegetables are soft.)  Add more salt if needed, and the vinegar.  Stir and served garnished with parsley, cheeses, and sour cream.
Grill Chicken and chop into pieces.  Fry bacon and break
In a large bowl, combine chicken, bacon, avocado, grapes, cranberries, and red onion.
In a small bowl, whisk together yogurt, honey, lemon juice, lemon zest, and black pepper.
Pour dressing over chicken salad mixture and toss to coat
Serve on bread/rolls/croissants with lettuce and cheese.
Sprinkle chicken with Lawrys Season Salt and Bake at 350Â° until just done.
Cool.  Cut into small chunks.
Chop a whole head stalk of celery fine.
In a large bowl, mix together 2 cups Miracle Whip and 2 cups Mayonnaise.
Shake in a small amount of black pepper, salt, onion salt, and poultry seasoning.
Mix in celery and chicken.
Store in a refrigerator overnight.  Taste and add more mayo & seasonings if needed.   Serve on small dime rolls.
Preheat the oven to 350Â°.
Grease a cookie sheet with sides generously with butter.
Slice the loaf of homemade bread (or you can use a loaf of french bread) into 8 thick slices (not using the two ends).
Lay bread on the tray.
I use my container and immersion blender for the next step but a bowl and mixer would work too.  Whip eggs, milk, whipping cream white sugar, brown sugar, and vanilla well.

In a small mixing bowl, make the topping by combining the flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt.  Then using a pastry cutter or two forks or whisks in a mixer, add the butter and beat until it forms a crumb mixture.
Pour egg/milk mixture over the bread
Sprinkle the topping over all of the pieces.
Bake for 40-45 minutes until bread is toasty.  Serve.
Cook pasta.
In a large skillet, slice & saute mushrooms in butter and then add ham.
Add cream & bring to a boil.
Add peas.  Cook 2 min.
Remove from Heat.
Toss in pasta & cheese.  Garnish with cheese.
Cook pasta.
Saute chicken, green onions, & mushrooms in oil until done.
Sprinkle flour on top & cook for 1 minute.
Add broth and stir until thickened.  Add sour cream.
Spray 9 x 13 pan & add tortellini.
Sprinkle with Â½ the cheese, add chicken sauce, & top with cheese.
Bake covered at 350Â° for 30 minutes.  Uncover and bake for 15 min.
Place all ingredients in a slow cooker (crockpot) and cook on low for 5-6 hours or high for 3-4 hours.  Shred & serve

Place chicken in a crockpot and sprinkle with Â½ half of the Italian seasoning.  Dice potatoes, layer on top of chicken, & sprinkle with the rest of the seasoning.  Cook on low 6-8 hours or high 4-5 hours.  Combine soup and cream cheese and add for the last hour of cooking.

name: Cafe Rio Sweet Pork

steps.text: Mix together in a small bowl the brown sugar, red pepper, salt, cumin, and paprika.
Spray crockpot with cooking spray.
Trim off any fat from the pork and put into a  crockpot.
Sprinkle the seasoning mixture over the pork evenly.
Add onion, garlic, chicken stock, and coke to the crockpot.
Cook for 4-6 hours on low.
Take pork out of the crockpot and shred it.
Add to the meat the Â½ cup of brown sugar and 1 tsp of paprika and let it dissolve into the meat by stirring.
Return the meat to the crockpot and cook for another 2 hours on low.  Serve warm.

notes: Use on Salads, or on top of Nachos, or in Tacos and  Burritos

steps.text: In a large bowl, combine chicken, cashews, apple, and cucumbers.
In a small bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, sugar, salt, and pepper.
Add to the chicken mixture and toss to coat.
Serve on buns or rolls with lettuce and cheese.
Mix all ingredients together.  Chill.  Serve on rolls or pitas.
Mix together the sour cream, chicken soup, Â½ of both cheeses, the taco seasoning, and dried onions.
Mix chicken with 1/2 of the soup mixture and stir.  Spoon onto tortillas, roll, & place, seam side down in sprayed dish
Top with the rest of the soup mixture and cheeses.
Bake at 350Â° for 20 to 30 minutes until heated through.
Mix half the sauce, cheeses, and chicken in a bowl.
Fill tortillas,  and place in a sprayed baking dish.
Top with the rest of the sauce and cheeses.
Bake at 350Â° for 20-30 min
In a large ziplock bag, put flour, salt, garlic powder, and pepper.  Add chicken and shake to coat all the chicken.
Heat 1 T of olive oil and 2 T of butter in a large fry pan.   Fry chicken until golden brown and no longer pink.  Remove and place on a plate and tent with foil.
In the same pan, add 1 T butter and the mushrooms and saute until golden brown, scraping bits of chicken off of the bottom of the pan.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Pour in marsala and broth.  Simmer until reduced by about half and starting to thicken.  (about 10-15 minutes)
Pour in the cream and put chicken back into the sauce.  Cook until thickens, about 3 more minutes.  Garnish with parsley and serve immediately over rice or pasta.

name: Chicken Mexican Casserole

steps.text: Drizzle olive oil over 12 oz of raw chicken breast meat cut into small slices and sprinkle lightly with taco seasoning.   Grill until done and cut into small pieces.
Heat oven to 375Â°  Spray a 9 x 13 baking dish and pour Â¼ cup of enchilada sauce in the bottom and tilt to spread.

In a large bowl, mix together the remaining enchilada sauce, chicken, sour cream, half of the green onions, and the taco seasoning.  Arrange 2 tortillas on the bottom of the baking dish.  (cut if necessary so they fit better.)  Layer with Â½ of the chicken mixture.  Sprinkle with â cup of cheese.  Repeat with another layer.
Cover and bake for 30-35 minutes.  Remove foil.
op with Tortilla chips, Â½ of the tomatoes, Â½ of the olives, and the rest of the green onions and cheese.
Bake uncovered for 5 minutes.  Remove and top with the rest of the fresh tomatoes and olives.

notes: Note:  Can use 6-8 corn tortillas in this recipe as an alternative to flour if preferred.

steps.text: Cut chicken into Â½ inch pieces and prepare vegetables.
In a 4 quart saucepan, combine water, chicken, carrots, celery and onion.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add chicken bouillon, pepper, and butter.
Dissolve cornstarch and flour into the milk.  Pour through a strainer into the chicken mixture.  (to catch any lumps).
Add whipping cream.  Simmer for 3 more minutes stirring frequently until thickened.   Add peas and set aside.
Make crust--See recipe in Desserts.
Roll out the bottom crust and place in a pie pan.  Pour filling into the pie pan.  Roll out the top crust.

Wet edges of bottom crust with water before laying top crust on.  Cut slits to allow steam to escape.  Press down edges to seal.  Cover edges with aluminum foil.  Bake at 400Â° for 35 minutes.  Take off foil and bake for another 10 minutes âtil golden brown.  Let stand for 15 to 20 min.
Preheat the oven to 425Â°F.  Line a pan with parchment paper.
Combine flour and season salt in a bowl.
Combine pepper, salt, garlic powder, parsley flakes, paprika, parmesan cheese, bread crumbs and cornflake crumbs.
Lightly dredge chicken in flour mixture.
Dip chicken in egg mixture (eggs and milk) and then bread crumb mixture.
Place chicken on the prepared pan. Bake for 18-22 minutes
Cut steak into small pieces.
Saute Mushrooms in butter in a large frying pan.  Remove
Sear meat in 1 T of butter.
Add potatoes and carrots.
Mix together soup, milk, and onion in a small bowl.  Pour over meat and vegetables.
Cover and simmer on low for 1-1 Â½ hours.
In a large fry pan, cook chicken or beef with garlic and ginger, breaking the meat into small pieces.
Add to the meat, all of the vegetables and 1 T of Olive Oil & fry until veggies are slightly soft  & cabbage wilted.
Stir in soy sauce and sesame oil and remove from heat.
Make a paste from the flour and water.

Lay out a single egg roll wrapper in a diamond shape with one point facing you and the other pointing away.  Put some filling in the middle.  Use the flour paste on 3 sides excluding the one side pointing towards you.

Begin rolling up by taking that side without paste and laying it over the top of the filling.  Fold in the two sides and roll up.  Press down to secure the end point to the eggroll.  Roll as tightly as you can as this will help prevent greasy egg rolls.  Fry in oil at 350Â° for 3-5 min.
In a large frying pan, heat olive oil until it is hot.  Rub roast with salt and pepper and sear all sides of the roast.
Place in a crockpot and sprinkle with onion soup mix.
Mix bouillon into water and pour over the meat.
Cook for 8-10 hours on low.Remove from the pot and shred with a fork.  Place meat on rolls, top with cheese.
Broil open faced in oven to melt cheese and toast bread.
Strain the juice and serve in small bowls for dipping.
In a large frying pan, heat olive oil until it is hot.  Rub roast with salt and pepper and sear all sides of the roast.
Place in a crockpot and sprinkle with onion soup mix.
Mix bouillon into water and pour over the meat.
Cook for 8-10 hours on low. Remove from the pot and shred with a fork
Mix BBQ Sauce and meat
Broil open faced in oven to melt cheese and toast bread.
After melting the cheese, top with shredded cabbage.
Thinly slice the onion and the pepper.
Mix the juices, olive oil, and all of the spices in a small bowl to make the marinade.
Reserve Â¼ cup of this marinade.
Cut chicken into strips and place in a ziplock bag.  Add the remaining marinade and seal.  Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or longer for better extra flavor.
Cook chicken in a hot skillet until cooked through but not dry.  Remove from the pan.
Add peppers, onions, and Â¼ cup of marinade to the same pan and cook and stir for 5 minutes until tender.
Return chicken to the pan and cook with onions and peppers until heated through.  About 2 more minutes.
Scoop chicken into warm tortillas and serve with assorted toppings if desired, like cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, sour cream, etc.
Brown ground beef in a frying pan with the garlic.  Once it is browned, add the ginger, soy sauce, cabbage, onion, and carrots.  Stir fry until vegetables are soft
Remove from heat and add sesame oil.
Lay wraps flat and wet the edges with water or flour water paste mixture so wraps will seal.
Put a small scoop of filling on each wrap, fold, and press down to seal the edges.  Place on a parchment lined tray.
When ready to cook, heat a skillet with 1 T of vegetable oil and coat the entire bottom of your pan.  Place gyozas in a single layer and fry each side until golden brown.
Add 1-2 T of water and put a lid on the pan to steam them slightly.  Dump from the pan and repeat the process adding new vegetable oil to the bottom of your pan.
Combine Rice Wine Vinegar, Soy Sauce, Garlic, Ginger, and Pepper Flakes to make dipping sauce.
Add water to a large pot and cook pasta according to the package directions.  Drain, but do not rinse.
In a saucepan, melt butter and add milk and flour, whisking in the flour a little at a time so there are no lumps.  Do this before the milk has time to heat up.
Add seasonings and cook on medium high heat stirring continuously so it does not burn.
When mixture boils and begins to thicken, remove from the heat.

Add cheese.  (Can substitute whatever kind of cheese you want to use for different flavors.)  The sauce is hot enough to melt the cheese.  Never add the cheese while the sauce is cooking (except with velveeta).
Place drained noodles in a bowl or pan that is microwaveable or able to go into an oven.
Cover the noodles with the sauce and stir.
Top with more cheese and melt in the microwave or under the broiler in an oven.
Brown ground beef.
Add all other ingredients and stir.
Simmer on low for 30 minutes.  Add water if too thick.
Steam Broccoli.
Combine ingredients except Â½ of the cheese.
Place in a 9 x 13 pan and top with cheese.
Coat Â¼ cup Panko bread crumbs with 1 T Butter.
Sprinkle on top.  Bake uncovered at 400Â° for 20 min.
Boil lasagna noodles according to package directions.
If you donât like chunks of tomato, grind up tomatoes in a blender and strain through a colander to get out seeds.
Brown ground beef in a skillet with the garlic.  Drain off any fat.  Add basil, salt, tomato paste, and tomatoes.  Simmer until thick, about 15-30 minutes.
In a medium bowl, add cottage cheese, parmesan cheese, parsley, egg, and pepper.  Mix together well.
Place 3 noodles in the bottom of a 9 x 13 baking dish.
Spread Â½ of the cottage cheese mixture on the noodles
Top with Â½ of the mozzarella slices and â of the meat sauce.  Repeat for the next layer.
Lay the last 3 noodles on top and cover with remaining meat sauce and shredded mozzarella cheese.  Bake not covered at 375Â° for 30 minutes.  Let stand for 10 min.
Saute onion in 1 T of olive oil for 3 minutes.
Add garlic, bell peppers, and mushrooms and saute for 3 more minutes.
Add lentils, carrots, celery, seasoning, and water.
Bring to a boil and reduce heat.  Cover and cook for 30 minutes.
Drain any remaining liquid and pulse in a food processor until desired texture.
Heat tortillas and top with mixture.
Garnish with lettuce, cheese, tomatoes, sour cream, guacamole, etc.

In a mixing bowl, dissolve yeast in water.  Add sugar, egg, 1 cup flour, and salt.  Beat on low for 3 minutes.  Add enough remaining flour to make a soft dough.  Knead for another 6-8 minutes.  Place in a greased bowl and cover.  Place in a warm place to let rise until double.
In a large skillet, brown ground beef with onion.  Drain fat if needed.  Add cabbage, onion salt, and pepper.  Cover and cook on medium heat until cabbage is soft.  Remove from heat and cool.
Punch down dough and divide into 12 equal pieces.  Gently flatten each piece into a 5 inch circle.  Top with Â¼ cup of filling.  Fold dough over filling to meet in the center and pinch edges to seal.

Place with the seam side down on a greased baking sheet.  Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled.  About 30 min.  Brush with melted butter and Bake at 350Â°  for 20 minutes or until golden brown.  Serve warm.

name: Navajo tacos

steps.text: The base for these is either scones or pitas.  (see note below.)
Place pitas or scones on individual plates.
Heat chilli for at least 5 minutes.
While the chilli is heating, shred the lettuce, chop the tomato and the avocado into small pieces, and slice the olives.
Top scone or pita with chilli, cheese, lettuce, tomato, avocado, salsa, olives, more cheese, and sour cream.  Drizzle thousand island dressing on top if you want.
Serve immediately.

notes: NOTE:  Bakeryâs often sell premade scones or pitas.  You may also make your own.  See recipes for homemade scones or pitas.    Another option is to buy Rhodes rolls and defrost 8 of them.  Combine two rolls into a disk and roll out into a pita shape.  Place on a greased cookie sheet and let rise until double.  Then bake at 350Â° until golden brown.  About 10-15 minutes.

steps.text: Fry chicken and onion in olive oil. Cut into pieces.
Add cream milk, paprika, salt and pepper.
Simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Add sour cream.
Serve over rice and sprinkle parsley on top.
Heat oven to 350Â°.  Spray a 9 x 13 dish.
Mix together hash browns, ham, and cheese.
Place into 9 x 13.  Whisk together the eggs, milk, salt, & pepper.  Pour egg mixture over hash browns.
Bake for 1 hour.
Cook pasta according to package directions and drain.
In a large pan, add olive oil, onions, garlic, and ground beef.  Fry until onions are clear and ground beef is cooked

Remove from the pan.  Add to the pan the butter, the salt, the pepper, and the cubed and rinsed potatoes.  Fry until soft.  (if you quarter small potatoes like in the picture, they will take a bit longer to fry, 15-17 minutes whereas cubes take about 13.  Fry on medium low heat with a cover on the pan.  Remove from the pan.

Add beans to the large pan, including water, and boil for 5 minutes.  Drain beans and put back into the pan with water and chicken bouillon.  Add potatoes, meat mixture, parsley, and heat through.    Top with cheese and serve.

name: Pot Roast Dinner

steps.text: Brown all sides of roast in a frying pan with 1 T oil.
Place in a slow cooker & add seasonings, onion, & broth.
Cook for 6 hours on low.  Add potatoes & carrots on top of meat and cook for another 2-3 hours on low until soft.

notes: NOTE:  Can also cook in oven covered for 5 hours at 275Â°

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 425Â°
In a mixing bowl, combine all ingredients.
Roll into 1â balls or scoop into 1â balls.
Place on an ungreased cookie sheet and bake for 10-15 minutes until cooked through and browned.  Serve.

Add milk and velveeta cheese into a microwaveable bowl and cook for 2 minutes.  Stir with a whisk and cook for 1 more minute.  Stir until smooth.  Add â cup of the Salsa and stir.  This makes your queso.
In a frying pan, brown ground beef and break into small pieces.  Add taco seasoning, drained & rinsed black beans, water, and ketchup.  Simmer on medium heat until all liquid has evaporated out.
Cover sheet pan with the entire bag of tortilla chips.
Cover chips with grated cheese, meat and black bean mixture, and small scoops of refried beans.
Toast nachos under the broiler (top rack) in the oven on 500Â° for 3-4 minutes until the cheese is melted.
While cheese is melting, chop tomato, avocado, and olives.   After cheese is melted, ladle queso on chips and top with olives, tomatoes, salsa, avocado, and sour cream.
Brown ground beef with onions and garlic.
Add salt, pepper, and chilli powder while browning.
Drain grease (if needed).
Stir in worcestershire sauce, A-1, water, and ketchup.
Simmer for 5-10 minutes until most of the liquid has cooked out.
Serve on toasted hamburger buns with cheese.
Make pizza dough.  Roll out into 2 or 3 rectangles.
Place mozzarella cheese down the center.
Top with whatever toppings you desire.
Slice the edges up to the cheese on each side and braid closed.
Let rise for 30 minutes if possible.
. Bake at 375Â° for 20-25 until golden brown.  Serve with spaghetti sauce and parmesan cheese.
Divide dough into 8-9 pieces.  Form into a circle.
Roll out onto parchment paper until about ââ thick.
Let rise for 15-20 Min.
Bake on a preheated stone at 500Â° for 5 min. âtil golden brown.
Spray a 9 x 13 pan.  Preheat the oven to 375Â°.
Arrange chicken breasts into the pan so they all lay flat.
Top each piece of chicken with sliced swiss cheese.
In a small bowl, mix together soup and milk to form a thick gravy.  Spoon or pour over the chicken and cheese.
In a small mixing bowl, melt butter and add dry stuffing mix and toss to coat all the pieces.  Spread on top.
Bake uncovered for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
Place all ingredients in a ziplock bag and marinate 2 hours.
Let meat come to room temperature.  Then grill on high heat.
Drizzle chicken with olive oil & season salt.
Let sit for 30 minutes.
Make salad mix.  Grill chicken & cut into strips.
Broil pitas with chicken & cheeses to melt.
Fill with salad & dressing.
Whip egg in a bowl.
Add all other ingredients and combine.
Press into sprayed muffin tin.
Bake at 350Â° for 15-20 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 375F.
Lightly grease an 8 or 9-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Set aside.
Brown the ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Drain excess fat.
Add the onions to the skillet and sautÃ© for 4 to 5 minutes until translucent.
Add the garlic and cook, stirring frequently, for an additional minute.
Stir in Worcestershire sauce and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Transfer ground beef mixture to the prepared baking dish and spread evenly.
Mix soup and milk and pour over meat.  Top with green beans, followed by the cheddar cheese. Make sure to season the green bean layer.
Finally, top with tater tots.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until tater tots are golden brown and cheese is melted.  Serve immediately.

name: Vegetable Mini Quiches

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 375Â°
Cut out small circles of crust and place inside a muffin tin.
Whip eggs and milk or cream.
Add salt and pepper and garlic.
Chop and cook the meats you want to put in.
Chop all vegetables you want to put in.
Fold in meat and vegetables.
Pour mixture into the muffin tins with the crusts.
Bake 14-15 minutes until cooked through and lightly brown.
Sprinkle cheese on top
Cool in pan for 2 minutes and then remove and serve warm.

notes: NOTE:  You can make these without the pie crust bottom just remember to spray muffin tin.  You can also use the pie crust recipe for these.

steps.text: Cook Pasta according to package directions.  Drain well!!!  Do not rinse.
Drain pineapple and oranges and reserve the juices.  Drain well!!  I let this sit on the counter in a strainer even after I have taken the juice so they are really drained.
Measure the amount of juice and place in a saucepan.  Add flour and whisk.  (Amount is 1 T per 1 cup of juice)
Add to juice the sugar, eggs, and salt and whisk until all combined.
Cook over medium heat until the mixture has boiled and thickened.  Put into a cool bowl and place in the fridge to chill for at least 4 hours, overnight is better.
Chill pasta and fruit in a large bowl that you will make the salad in.
When you're ready to put the salad together, add the thickened juice mixture to the fruit and pasta.  Stir gently.
Fold in cream, bananas, and pomegranate perils.  Serve.
Cook pasta al dente & drain and rinse under cold water.
In the meantime, prep all your other ingredients.

Drain the pineapple well.   In a large bowl, whisk together the ranch dressing and mayonnaise.  Add in the chicken, drained pineapple, celery, green onions, red and green grapes, cranberries and cooked pasta.
Toss to combine so everything is coated.
Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.  Just before serving, stir in the cashews.
Place all the ingredients into a jar except the last lemon juice and sugar and mix with an immersion blender.
Add last lemon juice and sugar
Chill for 1-2 hours in the fridge before serving.

ingredients.name: Hidden Valley Ranch Salad Dressing Mix

steps.text: Cut the top off the jalapeno, cut most of the stems off the cilantro, husk the tomatillos, and squeeze the juice from the lime and place all these and the rest of the ingredients into a blender.  Mix until creamy.  Chill for 1-2 hours before serving.  Flavor is better with time.
Place all ingredients in a tall cup or jar and blend with an immersion blender.  Chill 1 hour or serve immediately.
Put frozen chicken in a baking dish.  Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with taco seasoning.  Coat.  Grill or Fry.
Drain and rinse beans and warm in a pan with corn & juice.  Add a small amount of taco seasoning to this.
Cut lettuce and veggies.  Build salads and serve with southwest dressing, sour cream, cheese, and chips.
Add Ingredients to make a salad
Cook pasta according to package directions.  Drain and rinse with cold water and then drain again well.
Prepare all vegetables by chopping into very small pieces the onion, pickles, and two types of cabbage.  (Small square chopper).  Cut the cucumbers into small pieces.
Boil eggs.  Put eggs in cold water in a saucepan.  Bring to boil and boil for 15 min.  Cool in cold water, peel & chop with the small square chopper as well.
In a large bowl, mix the mayo, vinegar, mustard, sugar, salt, and pepper together.
Add vegetables, eggs, and pasta and toss until everything is well coated.  Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.  Add cheese squares just before serving.
Cook pasta.
Rinse with cold water and drain well
Pour dressing over noodles and marinate them for Â½ hour.  Just before serving, add vegetables and cheese.  Can season with McCormick Salad Supreme Seasoning.
Cook pasta.
Rinse with cold water and drain well.
Place pasta in a large bowl and add avocado, red onion, bacon, lettuce and tomatoes.  Drizzle Ranch on top and toss.

name: Potato Salad

steps.text: Wash and boil potatoes until tender.  Cool with water, peel and cut into cubes.
Place eggs in cold water in a saucepan.  Bring to boil and reduce heat and cook on low boil for 15 minutes.  Cool with water and peel and chop.
Chop celery, pickles, and onion into very small pieces.  Slice green onion.
In a large bowl, mix mayo, mustard, and seasonings.  Add cooled potatoes, eggs, and vegetables.
Mix until combined.  Add more mayo if needed.  Salad should have more of a dry texture than runny.
Garnish with Paprika and serve.

notes: Note:  You can make this as big or small as you want.  Just always have 2 more eggs than potatoes.  If you make more just add additional mayo, mustard, and seasonings.

steps.text: Beat together milk and pudding.
Fold in Cool Whip.
Cut up apples and snickers into slices and chunks and mix in.  Drizzle top with caramel sauce.  Serve Cold.
Shred cabbages and carrots and mince parsley.
Mix together Mayonnaise, sugar, lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, black pepper, salt and pour over vegetables.  Toss.
Brown ground beef.  Drain beans and corn.  Add to meat along with a squirt of ketchup, about â cup of water, and some taco seasoning.  Heat through, cooking until all liquid has evaporated.
Chop lettuce, tomatoes, and avocado and put into a large bowl.
Drain olives well and add to the lettuce vegetable mix.
Add meat and beans mixture, cheese, and chips and toss.
Serve immediately with thousand island dressing and sour cream.  (I like lighthouse dressing best for this.)
